speaker: Director
lines: Last night, we received a missive telling of his success, but before we could extract him, a— a thick fog set in over Rockport, which prevented us from sending a sphere to collect him and the Relic. Um, however there is a commuter train that operates out of Rockport that runs from Rockport through the… the Teeth, the mountain range that separates the continent below and ends in Neverwinter, where we could more safely and discreetly extract him. He managed to secure passage on this train, loaded his cargo onto the train, but before it could depart he was… murdered. Ah, which is, leaving us in quite a sticky situation.

We can’t explain what he was doing there, why he was murdered— we don’t even know why he was murdered because, ostensibly, nobody would know about the Grand Relic unless they were in the, the, Bureau of Balance. lines: Uh, okay, the three of you fully get through, uh, the door- well, by door I mean “makeshift hole that you have just blasted in the side of this thing,” and have made it out onto the swamp. It is very, very tricky terrain. Um, one might even call it “difficult terrain.” It’s hard to keep your footing, and it’s hard to sort of keep yourself moving so you don’t also, uh, get glorped down.

speaker: Travis
lines: Don’t my magic jumping boots, like, help me in difficult terrain? Am I making that up?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, I think you’re making it up.

speaker: Travis
lines: Mm…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Mm?

speaker: Griffin
lines: I guess it’s open to debate, but I think—

speaker: Travis
lines: If only this game were made of everyone making stuff up, huh? [Clint laughs] Anyways.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, you, uh— yeah. So the three of you have made it out. The sphere is almost totally submerged. Um—

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh, I left my wallet in there!

speaker: Taako
lines: Would—what if I were to do like, um—if I were to use the Ray of Frost, could I freeze the swamp around it? Would that work?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, it’s worth a shot.

speaker: Taako
lines: We got a thing going here?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah yeah, let’s see what happens.

speaker: Merle
lines: Maybe the blue ring would help him too.

speaker: Taako
lines: That’s a frost resistance ring.

speaker: Merle
lines: Well, yeah, but it ices beverages.

speaker: Taako
lines: It helps me, uh —

speaker: Griffin
lines: A swamp is not a beverage. I’m just going to go ahead and cut— cut you off at the pass there, Dad. Swamps aren’t drinkable.

speaker: Taako
lines: Swamps aren’t beverages.

speaker: Clint
lines: Well, don’t force your- [laughing] your choices on me!

speaker: Justin
lines: Hey, old man! My daddy can drink any swamp he wants.

speaker: Justin
lines: [trying to do Taako’s voice at first] Uh, okay, I’ll cast, uh, Ray of Frost to try to um, to try— sorry, like, morphed back into Justin because I’m not saying out loud what I’m doing. I’m gonna cast ring of frost, Ray of Frost, uh, on the- sort of the, like, swamp around the ball to try to halt its sinkage.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, okay, yeah, you do that. You uh, you sort of do a quick circle of Ray of Frost around the sphere, and you have managed to freeze at least the top part of the swamp which has managed to halt the descent of your, uh, of your sphere.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay, okay, listen, listen. We need to get busy here. I don’t have— I don’t have any magic that can help point us in the direction that we need to go- We’re trying to catch a train, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yes. Um, yeah.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Taako
lines: I don’t have a—none of my spells sort of leap to mind that would be, uh, helpful to us. Um—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Your uh—

speaker: Taako
lines: Tasha’s Hideous Laughter, nothing. You guys have any, like, spells, or abilities? Can I do a perception check to see if I can- can sense any, like, train-like activities?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, can you do— sorry? A perception check to see if you sense any “train-like” abilities…?

speaker: Justin
lines: [laughing] I mean, like, a distant floodlamp, or perhaps, a place where tracks used to be but aren’t right now.

speaker: Travis
lines: This is a solid, solid puzzle.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, that is some solid dungeoneering, is what that is.

speaker: Justin
lines: Good news, I got a one.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So you failed on your— you critically failed, on your, uh—

speaker: Travis
lines: So you just go, “What’s a train?”

speaker: Travis
lines: But we— we know the direction, we could—

speaker: Justin
lines: I fall over and start shoveling swamp into my mouth. [laughs]

speaker: Clint
lines: Do we have a map or anything?

speaker: Travis
lines: We could see Rockport when when we landed, like we have a general idea—

speaker: Griffin
lines: The three of you, the three of you— I’m gonna set the scene. The three of you are standing in swamp water, just sort of stomping around to keep yourself from sinking. Uh, you have frozen the swamp around the sphere… Um, as the three of you are debating furiously about what trains could possibly be close to you, uh, you hear kind of a… goopy sound coming from above you, in the uh, the canopy of the trees above. And, uh… you hear a goopy sound.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay.

speaker: Justin
lines: A goopy sound?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, kind of like a [making wet noises with his mouth]

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh, great.

speaker: Justin
lines: [laughing] Okay, can I do a, uh, can I do a perception check to see if any, like—

speaker: Travis
lines: Let’s all do a perception check. I got a 16.

speaker: Justin
lines: I got a… 13.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh, I got 15, ‘cause I have a minus one perception.

speaker: Clint
lines: Fourteen.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Magnus, you, uh, you see, just for a flash of a second - uh, a, uhhh… green, slimy eyestalk, popping out of the canopy of the largest tree above. Um, and as soon as you sort of make eye contact with it, it zips back up into the tree.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Hello! Wha— Do you know where the train is?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Magnus, actually, as you yell at it to try and um, negotiate or get some information, um, the eyestalk pops back out. And then further down the branch, another eyestalk pops out. And then from a hole in the tree another eyestalk pops out.

speaker: Magnus
lines: What up?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um, and slowly from those three positions you see, uh, begin to climb out, these dark green… leeches begin to come out of the tree. The ones on the branches are descending towards you on strings of goo and plop down on the surface of the swamp next to you. The one coming out of the tree has made it down to the base of the tree. And the- the one that just came down off the tree, the biggest one, rears back and opens a mouth lined with three rows of razor-sharp teeth, and it begins hissing at you.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Hello!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, and it’s, uh-

speaker: Magnus
lines: So, I was asking about a train?

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Chuckles] Uh, and it is, uh, it’s initiative time.

speaker: Griffin
lines: …do you guys remember battles?

speaker: Travis
lines: I’ve heard of them.

speaker: Justin
lines: Five.

speaker: Clint
lines: Twenty.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Wow. Top of the order is Merle! Uh you are on difficult terrain, which means that your movement speed is going to be halved. The leeches are… basically lined up in a row in front of you, they all came down off the same tree. Uh and they are- they’re close; they’re about 10 feet away.

speaker: Clint
lines: Alright, I wanna cast Thorn Whip at them.

speaker: Griffin
lines: What is that? I ha— I have no idea what you’re talking about.

speaker: Clint
lines: Alright. [Travis laughs] “You create a long, vine-like whip covered in thorns that lashes out at your command towards a creature in range. You make a melee spell attack against the target, if the attack hits, the creature takes 1d6 piercing damage, and if the creature is large or smaller, you pull the creature up to 10 feet closer to you.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Is this a spell, wh— is this a second level spell?

speaker: Clint
lines: This is one of the cantrips that was granted to me when I switched over.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] Oh, oh, oh, I see, cool. Okay. Alright, sweet! Whip away.

speaker: Clint
lines: Fifteen.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Fifteen, is that just what you rolled?

speaker: Clint
lines: That’s what I rolled.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And then you have your spellcasting modifier and you have plus one because you have your Extreme Teen Bible now.

speaker: Clint
lines: Ah, so… plus five!

speaker: Griffin
lines: I think it was plus five before, so it should be plus six with your Teen Bible, so 21.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh yeah, that’s a hit.

speaker: Clint
lines: Right, and then I roll a d6?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Mhm.

speaker: Clint
lines: …It’s a six! Perfect.

speaker: Travis
lines: Magnus yells,

speaker: Magnus
lines: Don’t move ‘em!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Um… Wait, do you have to move ‘em?

speaker: Clint
lines: Doesn’t have to, uh-uh.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Mmkay. Cool. Yeah, you, uh, you have whipped him. You whipped him good.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, are you done—?

speaker: Justin
lines: How many, like, little things are poking out? Like—

speaker: Griffin
lines: There are 3 leeches.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay. So which one did he just, uh, whip?

speaker: Clint
lines: The one in the middle.

speaker: Griffin
lines: The one in the middle? The one that came down off the branch?

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Griffin & Justin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um, are you done with your turn?

speaker: Clint
lines: Um, I think so.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Uh, you sink into the swamp to about your waist.

speaker: Travis
lines: Good luck.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Next in the order is Magnus.

speaker: Clint
lines: Do we know how much damage we did to him?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, six damage, you said it out loud with your mouth.

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh, okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: Um… I’m going to run over to the tree, or move to the tree they came down off of?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Mmkay.

speaker: Travis
lines: And I’m going to use Railsplitter to fell it so it fallxs over on top of all three of them.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [amused] Okay, awesome. Uh… yeah, you, uh— distribute a devastating chop to the base of the tree that the three of them came down on, angled in a manner to make it sort of slide off in their direction. You give it the old Bushido Blade. It’s almost like—

speaker: Justin
lines: I think it’s pronounced “Buscemi Blade.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: You give the old Buscemi Blade. It’s like you didn’t— it’s like you felt nothing as you went through. It was almost like you were, uh, chopping through a curtain or something.

speaker: Justin
lines: Sorry, I need to mute our mic. Dad has decided to take this opportunity to enjoy a popcorn snack.

speaker: Clint
lines: [quietly] Sorry.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, wow! So, literally, the worst possible audible thing.

speaker: Clint
lines: I put it down.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Please don’t eat a popcorn snack. You—

speaker: Justin
lines: I was actually looking forward to enjoying the popcorn snack with you, so I’m a little sad about pointing it out.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well, maybe like, during a break. Um, you— no, it’s not like we couldn’t tell that you weren’t eating a goddamn popcorn snack. It was like you were breakdancing on—

speaker: Clint
lines: Really? How do you know this was my first bag?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Travis is doing some dope shit, if you guys would allow him.

speaker: Travis
lines: Thank you!

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, yeah…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um… the Railsplitter passes through the tree like a, like a baseball bat passing through a ghost.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um, and the tree slides off of the base. It begins to fall in a straight line towards the leeches. And they are going to make dexterity saving throws to try and get out of the way.The first one, the one at the base closest to the tree, rolled a two, which is a five, that’s not gonna do it. The one in the middle that just got attacked, got a 19, that will do it. He uh, darts forward towards you. Um, uh— I’m assuming, Travis, that you ran over to the base of the tree to make this happen?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yes.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: I- I stated that.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Mmkay. Um, and the third one rolls an 18, which is sufficient. He darts forward too. But the tree falls to the side, and just completely obliterates the, uh, the leech that was closest to the base, the one that was actually right next to you, Magnus.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Did someone eat popcorn?

speaker: Clint
lines: Dang, he’s good!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, I’m really good. Uh, so you have destroyed one of these leeches. Uh, there’s two left.

speaker: Travis
lines: Uh, and I’m going—

speaker: Justin
lines: I just wanna say, like, this is the first D and— I appreciate that this is a podcast. This is the first DnD, in history, where someone has not been able to enjoy a salty snack.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, really.

speaker: Justin
lines: Like, never— like, the two shouldn’t even- -it should be in the fuckin’ Player’s Handbook. Like, “Be sure to get your salty snack to enjoy as you play DnD.”

speaker: Clint
lines: Re- realism is just blown all to hell right now.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah!

speaker: Clint
lines: Sorry, but I feel that way.

speaker: Justin
lines: I feel like I’m working— I feel like I’m preparing my taxes. That’s what DnD is without salty snacks.

speaker: Justin
lines: There. I got that off of my chest.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well— we’ll need to come up with some sort of a, like a, one of those booths that they have at carnivals, where the money blows around?

speaker: Justin
lines: Listen to Rosa Crunch over here!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Listen to who?

speaker: Justin
lines: Rosa Crunch! He’s not going to the back of the snack bus!

speaker: Travis
lines: Well, you know she wasn’t called Rosa Van, right, Justin?

speaker: Griffin
lines: She wasn’t called Rosa Bus. What’re you talking about?

speaker: Justin
lines: [laughing] He’s just gonna keep crunching.

speaker: Clint
lines: Go ahead, move me! [crunching continues for the rest of the podcast]

speaker: Travis
lines: I’m gonna step up on- I’m gonna step up onto the stump.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Mmkay, you’re stumping.

speaker: Justin
lines: Well, that’s a good idea.

speaker: Griffin
lines: This podcast is an auditory nightmare hellscape.

speaker: Justin
lines: Thanks for the money, though.

speaker: [theme music starts to play, one last Max Fun Drive message, and the podcast ends]
